snippet: Baden-Baden, Germany, played host to three of the most important tournaments in chess history in an era when it was difficult for the best players to face off against one another.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column observes that Baden-Baden, Germany, played host to three of the most important tournaments in chess history in eras when it was difficult for the best players to face off against one another due to the lack of modern transportation.
